sub_topic: Finding the area of a parallelogram.
message_1: A parallelogram has a base of 6 meters and a height of 3 meters. What is the area of the parallelogram?
message_2:
The area of a parallelogram can be calculated using the formula:

Area = base × height

In this case, the base is 6 meters and the height is 3 meters. So, the area of the parallelogram is:

Area = 6 meters × 3 meters = 18 square meters
